Floating City Venue: Build a series of interconnected floating islands in a large body of water, such as a lake or ocean, to create a unique and futuristic Olympic venue. Each island would house a different sport or event, and athletes would travel between islands via a network of aerial tramways or personal watercraft. Confidence Score: 0.8

Time Traveling Venue: Develop a time-traveling theme for the Olympics, where athletes and spectators alike can travel through different eras of history to compete or watch events. The venue could include events such as ancient Greek wrestling, medieval jousting, and modern high-tech sports like virtual reality racing. Confidence Score: 0.9

Space Station Venue: Convert an existing or new space station into an Olympic venue, complete with zero-gravity athletic events and a view of Earth from orbit. Events could include weightlessness races, zero-gravity gymnastics, and spacewalking competitions. Confidence Score: 0.9

Underwater Venue: Host the Olympics in a large underwater stadium, complete with advanced water filtration and life support systems. Events could include swimming, diving, and underwater hockey, as well as unique events such as underwater obstacle courses and marine animal races. Confidence Score: 0.8

Robotics-themed Venue: Create a futuristic Olympic venue where robots and humans compete side-by-side in events such as robot soccer, robot gymnastics, and robot racing. The venue could also include interactive exhibits and demonstrations of cutting-edge robotics technology. Confidence Score: 0.9
